SourceText: This skill is talking about feelings with your teen.
text: Esta habilidad consiste en poder hablar de sentimientos con tu adolescente.

SourceText: Let‚Äôs do a True/False quiz:

SourceText: Talking about positive feelings is not as important as sharing our negative feelings.
text: Hablar sobre sentimientos positivos no es tan importante como compartir nuestros sentimientos negativos.

SourceText: That‚Äôs incorrect. There are 6 basic emotions: Happy, Sad, Angry, Disgusted, Surprised, and Afraid. It‚Äôs important that we talk with our teens about ALL of them.
text: ¬°Eso es falso! Recuerda que hay 6 emociones b√°sicas: alegr√≠a, tristeza, enojo, asco, sorpresa y miedo. Es importante que hablemos con nuestros adolescentes sobre TODAS ellas.

SourceText: That‚Äôs correct. There are 6 basic emotions: Happy, Sad, Angry, Disgusted, Surprised, and Afraid. It‚Äôs important that we talk with our teens about ALL of them.
text: ¬°Muy bien! Recuerda que hay 6 emociones b√°sicas: alegr√≠a, tristeza, enojo, asco, sorpresa y miedo. Es importante que hablemos con nuestros adolescentes sobre TODAS ellas.

SourceText: Sorry, I dont' understand what you mean.

SourceText: Here‚Äôs another one: Boys should not share when they are feeling sad or afraid.
text: Aqu√≠ te va otra: los ni√±os no deben compartir sus sentimientos cuando se sienten tristes o asustados.

SourceText: Incorrect. It is important that both boys and girls learn how to communicate about difficult feelings. Boys will learn that it is okay to feel upset or sad about something, and that it is okay to ask for help when they need it. This is important for girls, too!
text: ¬°Eso es falso! Es importante que tanto los ni√±os como las ni√±as aprendan como pueden comunicar sentimientos dif√≠ciles. Los ni√±os aprender√°n que est√° bien sentirse molestos o tristes por algo, y que est√° bien pedir ayuda cuando lo necesiten. ¬°Esto es importante tambi√©n para las ni√±as!

SourceText: You are right! It is important that both boys and girls learn how to communicate about difficult feelings. Boys will learn that it is okay to feel upset or sad about something, and that it is okay to ask for help when they need it.
text: ¬°Lo est√°s haciendo muy bien! Es importante que tanto los ni√±os como las ni√±as aprendan como pueden comunicar sentimientos dif√≠ciles. Los ni√±os aprender√°n que est√° bien sentirse molestos o tristes por algo, y que est√° bien pedir ayuda cuando lo necesiten. ¬°Esto es importante tambi√©n para las ni√±as.

SourceText: Last one: As parents, we can also share our feelings with our children.
text: Por √∫ltimo: Como madres, padres o personas cuidadoras, es importante que tambi√©n compartamos nuestros sentimientos con nuestras ni√±as, ni√±os y adolescentes.

SourceText: Correct! Sharing our own feelings with our children in a calm way shows them how to do it themselves.
text: ¬°Excelente! Compartir nuestros propios sentimientos de una manera tranquila con nuestras ni√±as, ni√±os y adolescentes les muestra c√≥mo podr√≠an hacerlo ellos mismos.

SourceText: Father: Hello my dear, how was your day at school?

SourceText: {F1_DAUGHTER_13}: Who cares?

SourceText: Father: {F1_DAUGHTER_13}, you don‚Äôt seem very happy, do you want to talk about it?

SourceText: {F1_DAUGHTER_13}: I‚Äôm sorry, Dad. I just find it so frustrating that I studied so hard for my maths test and failed.
text: {F1_DAUGHTER_13}: Lo siento, pap√°. Me encuentro muy frustrada porque estudi√© muy duro para mi ex√°men de matem√°ticas y fall√©.

SourceText: Father: That is frustrating, my dear. I know how hard you studied. Maybe we can ask your teacher for extra help with maths? I can come in to talk to her tomorrow if that would help.
text: Padre: No te preocupes, eso es frustrante, cari√±o. S√© lo duro que has estudiado. ¬øQuiz√°s podamos pedirle a tu maestra apoyo extra con matem√°ticas? Puedo ir a platicar con ella ma√±ana si eso ayuda.

SourceText: {F1_DAUGHTER_13}: Thank you. I think that might be a good idea.

SourceText: Father: You know, you might feel frustrated about not being good at maths right now, but I‚Äôve never met someone who can write stories as well as you can, {F1_DAUGHTER_13}.

SourceText: 1Ô∏è‚É£ *OPEN*
text: 1Ô∏è‚É£ *EMPATIZAR*

SourceText: üëÇ Listen to your teen when they share how they are feeling.
text: üëÇ Escucha a tus adolescentes cuando te compartan c√≥mo se sienten.

SourceText: üíõ Accept how they feel.
text: üíõ Acepta lo que est√°n sintiendo.

SourceText: üß∏ Give them comfort.
text: üß∏ Dales seguridad y tranquilidad.

SourceText: 3Ô∏è‚É£ *LEARN*
text: 3Ô∏è‚É£ *APRENDER*

SourceText: üí° Learn about different emotions.
text: üí° Aprendan sobre las diferentes emociones.

SourceText: üòÉ There are 6 basic emotions: Happy, Sad, Angry, Disgusted, Surprised, and Afraid.
text: üòÉ Existen 6 emociones b√°sicas: Alegr√≠a, tristeza, enojo, asco, sorpresa y miedo.

SourceText: üòî As children get older, they learn to identify lots of other emotions, like feeling excited, frustrated, proud, lonely, peaceful, guilty, or confused.
text: üòî A medida que las ni√±as y los ni√±os crecen, aprenden a identificar muchas otras emociones, como sentir emoci√≥n, frustraci√≥n, orgullo, soledad, calma, culpa o confusi√≥n.

SourceText: 4Ô∏è‚É£ *TALK*
text: 4Ô∏è‚É£ *CONVERSAR*

SourceText: üòí It is normal to have difficulty talking about and expressing emotions and feelings.
text: üòí Es normal tener dificultades para hablar y expresar sentimientos y emociones.

SourceText: üëã Remember, it is also normal to experience feelings in different ways.
text: üëã Recuerda, tambi√©n es normal experimentar sentimientos de diferentes maneras.

SourceText: üí° Learn to identify your own emotions, to experience them in our body, and to communicate about them.
text: üí° Aprende a identificar tus propias emociones, a experimentarlas en el cuerpo y a conversar acerca de ellas.

SourceText: 5Ô∏è‚É£ *NOTICE*
text: 5Ô∏è‚É£ *RECONOCER*

SourceText: üåà Begin to notice all emotions.
text: üåà Comienza a reconocer todas las emociones.

SourceText: üòÉ You can also share positive emotions such as a sense of peace, happiness, or calmness.
text: üòÉ Tambi√©n puedes compartir emociones positivas como la sensaci√≥n de paz, felicidad o calma.

SourceText: üíô It can also allow children to appreciate a beautiful moment or feeling of love!
text: üíô ¬°Esto tambi√©n permite que las ni√±as, ni√±os y adolescentes puedan apreciar un momento bonito o experimentar una sensaci√≥n de amor!

SourceText: *Create your own Recipe*
text: *Crea tu propia receta*

SourceText: Let your teen come up with a new meal idea!
text: ¬°Deja que tu ni√±a, ni√±o o adolescente invente una nueva idea de comida!

SourceText: üçö Create a new dish with @fields.child_nickname using ingredients they love!

SourceText: üîµ Together, choose two ingredients, and ask your teen to prepare a meal using them. For example: chicken and spinach, tomatoes and rice, maize and pumpkin.
text: üîµ Juntos, escojan dos ingredientes, y pidele a tu ni√±a, ni√±o o adolescente que prepare una comida con ellos. Por ejemplo: pollo y espinaca, tomates y arroz, ma√≠z y calabaza.

SourceText: üìù If you enjoy the meal, make it something your family eats weekly, and ask your teen to write it down for you. Give the meal a name and explain how to make it.
text: üìù Si les gusta la nueva receta, puede ser algo que coman semanalmente en familia, y pide a tu ni√±a, ni√±o o adolescente que escriba esa receta para ti. Denle un nombre especial a esa comida y expliquen c√≥mo hacerla.

SourceText: ‚ú® If your teen notices that you are learning from their cooking, it will boost their confidence!
text: ‚ú® ¬°Si tu adolescente se da cuenta que est√°s aprendiendo de su forma de cocinar, aumentar√° su confianza!

SourceText: *Dance moves*
text: *Movimientos de baile*

SourceText: Let's get moving! üëã Dancing is a great way to exercise, have fun, and bond with your teen at the same time! You both get to express yourselves in a fun, relaxed way.  üéµ
text: ¬°Vamos a movernos! üëã Bailar es una gran manera de hacer ejercicio, divertirse y conectar con tu ni√±a, ni√±o o adolescente al mismo tiempo! Ambos pueden llegar a expresarse de una manera relajada y divertida. üéµ

SourceText: This game can be played in pairs or a group with everyone taking turns being the leader:
text: Este juego se puede jugar en pares o en grupo tomando turnos para ser l√≠der:

SourceText: üì± Let your teen choose a song they like and create a set of dance moves.
text: üì± Deja que tu ni√±o, ni√±a o adolescente elija una canci√≥n que le guste e imaginen una secuencia de movimientos de baile.

SourceText: üëÄ First person does a dance move and everyone else copies it.
text: üëÄ La primera persona hace un movimiento de baile y todo el mundo la copia.

SourceText: ‚òÄÔ∏è Don‚Äôt worry about perfecting the dance moves, it‚Äôs all about having fun together!
text: ‚òÄÔ∏è No te preocupes por hacer movimientos de baile perfectos, ¬°se trata de divertirse juntos!

SourceText: üí° If you want to, you can perform your dance for the household!
text: üí° ¬°Si quieren, pueden bailar para la familia completa!

SourceText: *2 Truths, 1 Lie*
text: *2 Verdades, 1 Mentira*

SourceText: This is a fun, quick game, and the point of it is to learn things about each other. Make your answers as interesting as possible! üé®
text: ¬°Este es un juego divertido y r√°pido! el objetivo es aprender cosas sobre las y los dem√°s. ¬°Haz tus respuestas lo m√°s interesantes posible! üé®

SourceText: üí° Ask your teen to think of 3 facts about themselves. 2 must be true, 1 must be a lie.
text: üí° P√≠dele a tu ni√±a, ni√±o o adolescente que piense en 3 datos sobre s√≠ mismos. 2 deben ser verdaderos, 1 debe ser una mentira.

SourceText: üî∑ Here are some examples: I hate bananas, I have travelled to Kenya, my favourite subject in school was maths.
text: üî∑ Aqu√≠ hay algunos ejemplos: Odio los pl√°tanos, he viajado a M√©rida, mi tema favorito en la escuela son las matem√°ticas.

SourceText: üëÄ Share the facts with your teen and ask them to guess which one is a lie.
text: üëÄ Comparte tus datos con tu ni√±a, ni√±o o adolescente y p√≠deles que adivinen cu√°l es una mentira.

SourceText: üîÑ Now ask them to do the same, and guess theirs.
text: üîÑ Ahora p√≠deles que hagan lo mismo y adivina cual es la suya.

SourceText: Did you learn anything new about your teen, or did they learn anything new about you? üíõ

SourceText: *This is who I am*
text: *Esto es lo que soy*

SourceText: Self-esteem is the way you value yourself, either in a positive or negative way. Helping your teen to have high self-esteem is a recipe for success! üèÜ
text: El autoestima es la manera en que te valoras a ti mismo, ya sea de forma positiva o negativa. ¬°Ayudar a tu ni√±a, ni√±o o adolescente a tener un autoestima alto es la receta para el √©xito! üèÜ

SourceText: ‚≠êShare with your teen 3 things you like about yourself!
text: ‚≠ê¬°Comparte con tu ni√±a, ni√±o o adolescentes 3 cosas que te gustan sobre ti mismo!

SourceText: 3Ô∏è‚É£ Ask your teen to tell you 3 things they like about themselves.
text: 3Ô∏è‚É£ P√≠dele a tu ni√±a, ni√±o o adolescente que te comparta 3 cosas que le gustan de s√≠ mismo.

SourceText: For example: I am great at treating others kindly. I am great at styling my hair. I am great at football. ‚öΩ
text: Por ejemplo: Soy genial para tratar a otros amablemente. Soy genial para estilizar mi cabello. Soy genial en el f√∫tbol. ‚öΩ
